definitions.definition: Of or relating to a habit ; established as a habit; performed over and over again; recurrent , recurring .
examples: Her habitual lying was the reason for my mistrust.
Professor Franklein took his habitual seat at the conference table.

definitions.definition: Of a person or thing : engaging in some behaviour as a habit or regularly .
Pertaining to an action performed customarily , ordinarily , or usually .

main_definition: Of or relating to a habit ; established as a habit; performed over and over again; recurrent , recurring .
secondary_definitions: Of a person or thing : engaging in some behaviour as a habit or regularly .
( grammar ) Pertaining to an action performed customarily , ordinarily , or usually .
